actions.committee: Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

official_title: A bill to establish an incremental pricing program for the sale of all types and grades of motor gasoline.
short_title: Motor Gasoline Incremental Pricing Act of 1980

summary.text: Motor Gasoline Incremental Pricing Act of 1980 - Directs the President to establish a program providing for: (1) the distribution of coupons for purchasing gasoline at a discounted price; (2) the distribution of coupons for no more than 50 percent of each State's actual total of gasoline sold; (3) limitations on the price charged by gasoline retailers; (4) the distribution of coupons within each State; and (5) payments by or to retailers based on the amount of coupons collected. Restricts coupons to no more than two vehicles per family. Requires congressional approval of the regulations establishing such program.

titles.title: Motor Gasoline Incremental Pricing Act of 1980
A bill to establish an incremental pricing program for the sale of all types and grades of motor gasoline.
